results.title: How Elizabeth Olsen Came Into Her Powers
results.abstract: The actress started as an indie darling and never expected to become a Marvel linchpin as Wanda Maximoff. But she’s now so invested in the role, she’s open to a solo film.
des_facet: Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Olsen wanted to act since she was a child, but she was willing to wait after watching the experience of her sisters Mary-Kate and Ashley.

results.title: In Comedy, Timing Is Everything, Especially at Netflix’s Festival
results.abstract: Planned long before the streamer hit a rough patch, the expansive event had the feel of the end of an era. Still, there were plenty of stellar shows.

results.title: ‘Happening’ Review: An Abortion Story, an Existential Drama
results.abstract: In this powerful French movie set in the early 1960s, a young woman struggles to obtain an abortion when the procedure was criminalized.

results.title: Wayne Wang Still Isn’t Satisfied
results.abstract: On the 40th anniversary of his breakthrough drama, “Chan Is Missing,” the auteur says a new generation of Asian American filmmakers must make more challenging work.

results.title: Amber Heard Accuses ‘Belligerent’ Johnny Depp of Sexual Assault
results.abstract: With graphic depictions of what she described as physical attacks, she sought to counter the actor’s testimony that she had been the aggressor.

results.title: ‘Rust’ Production Appeals Fine for Cinematographer’s Death
results.abstract: The company, which was fined the maximum penalty allowed under state law, maintained that it did not violate safety protocols.

multimedia.caption: A prop cart on the set of “Rust,” where the cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was shot dead when a revolver that the actor Alec Baldwin was practicing with turned out to contain a live round.

results.title: Netflix Tells Employees Ads May Come by the End of 2022
results.abstract: Executives said they were aiming to introduce an ad-supported, lower-priced subscription tier in the last three months of the year, quicker than originally indicated.
results.byline: By John Koblin and Nicole Sperling

multimedia.caption: Netflix is facing significant business challenges after reporting a loss of 200,000 subscribers in the first three months of the year.
Netflix is facing significant business challenges after reporting a loss of 200,000 subscribers in the first three months of the year.

results.title: Ric Parnell, Real Drummer in a Famous Fake Band, Dies at 70
results.abstract: The central characters in the mockumentary “This Is Spinal Tap” were comic actors, but Mr. Parnell was an actual professional musician.

multimedia.caption: Ric Parnell performing with Spinal Tap in Minneapolis in 1992. His character, Mick Shrimpton, died near the end of the movie “This Is Spinal Tap,” released in 1984; when the band later went on tour, he was said to be Mick’s twin brother, Rick.

Ric Parnell performing with Spinal Tap in Minneapolis in 1992. His character, Mick Shrimpton, died near the end of the movie “This Is Spinal Tap,” released in 1984; when the band later went on tour, he was said to be Mick’s twin brother, Rick.

results.title: Sex, Death and Bunnies
results.abstract: In “Fatal Attraction,” the genre-defining 1987 erotic thriller, sex was the engine that moved the plot. It’s rare to see that in movies today.
results.byline: By Wesley Morris, Elyssa Dudley, Hans Buetow and Sasha Weiss

results.abstract: The film, set against the backdrop of fighting in the Donbas region in 2014, would be bracing and haunting even if it weren’t so timely.

results.title: Performing a Comedy About Abortion, Watching the Supreme Court
results.abstract: Alison Leiby had just performed her show “Oh God, a Show About Abortion” when she learned of the leaked draft opinion showing that the court could be on the verge of overturning Roe v. Wade.

multimedia.caption: Alison Leiby addressed the news that the Supreme Court could be on the verge of overturning Roe v. Wade at the start of her show, “Oh God, a Show About Abortion.”

results.title: In France, a Film Has Women Sharing Their Stories of Abortion
results.abstract: Following the release of “Happening,” about an illegal abortion in 1963, the country’s contemporary stigma around the procedure is facing scrutiny.

results.title: Cate Blanchett and Cindy Sherman: Secrets of the Camera Chameleons
results.abstract: On the 45th anniversary of Sherman’s acclaimed series “Untitled Film Stills,” they toured her show, discussing what an image, or a smile, may reveal.

multimedia.caption: “It’s interesting, you go through this process by yourself,” Blanchett told Sherman. “I’m not a great fan of the monologue.”
multimedia.copyright: Camila Falquez for The New York Times

results.title: Johnny Depp Lost $22.5 Million ‘Pirates’ Role After Op-Ed, Manager Says
results.abstract: Mr. Depp’s talent manager said the actor had been up to play Captain Jack Sparrow again until his ex-wife, Amber Heard, wrote an op-ed saying she was a “public figure representing domestic abuse.”
